basics.name: Robert John Holash
basics.label: Scientist, Muscle Physiology, Computational biology
basics.summary: A Canadian born research scientist, currently working at the University of Calgary in the fields of Health and Human Performance

work.name: Faculty of Kinesiology, University of Calgary
work.summary: Dr. John Holash is a recognized expert in the fields of Exercise Physiology, Muscle Physiology, and Computational Biology, currently serving as an assistant professor at the University of Calgary in the Faculty of Kinesiology's Human Performance Lab. His commitment to understanding and optimizing human performance is deeply rooted in both his academic pursuits and personal experiences as an athlete, adventurer and a researcher.

publications.name: Technological Breakthroughs in Sport
publications.summary: An encyclopedia article outlining the potential impacts of artificial intelligence (AI) and virtual reality (VR) on current sports science
